pros: very good place to work for
cons: nothing is invisible hahahaha uye

pros: Good heart work. Nice colleagues. Nice location. Get to travel regionally.
cons: Too many meetings, and many were not necessary. One person calls the shot.

pros: Projects are driven by people who care. Colleagues can be great people that support each other.
cons: Some units are not collaborative, salary offer is not market rate and yearly increment cannot compensate, upper management does not listen to improve but listen to defend their actions. Incapable of delegating just work loads and recognising valuable people.

review_title: Bland, but overall an OK working environment
pros: It was good when I was still able to work from home.
cons: Excessive workload, too many meetings.

pros: Doing meaningful work while engaging with global communities.
cons: Tended to be quite bureaucratic

pros:
Friendly colleagues
Good office location in town
cons:
bureaucracy 
high turnover rate of employees

pros: Learnt a lot especially how to be diplomatic. Learnt the importance of relationship building. Basically making friends for Singapore. Overall, colleagues are cordial and nice.
cons: Need to work long hours at times prior to events and during events.

pros: Town area. Very convenient for everyone. Best of all, it is located on top of a shopping mall. Convenient for all!
cons: Many red tapes for a small company. Management refuse to listen to suggestions and advices. High turnover rate. 10% turnover every month

pros: Nothing good other than the convenient location. Many choices of food around that area. Seriously nothing I can think of.
cons: Flat structure and people are difficult to work with. High turnover rate. Wouldn't encourage anyone to join unless you are really desperate to leave your current job. Life is hard there unless you know how to suck up to your boss.

pros: Get to work with kind-hearted volunteers, wanting to make an impact. Have traveling opportunities to regional countries, allowing you to gain vast experiences in managing diverse culture.
cons: Increasing paperworks, which in my opinion more than half are not necessary. Could be more transparent in foundation strategies.

pros: Good staff training, gain international exposure and experience, fulfilling work, clear vision/direction.
cons: Low tolerance for mediocre performers, travel fatigue.
